As we work on mending our mental health, please use meditation as a resource to cope with all the stress!  In this new journey, please know it‚Äôs okay to ‚Äúmess up‚Äù and wonder, but as long as you keep up with, you can reap the benefits!  The goal is to practice meditation as frequently as possible aim for 4x a week for about at least 10 min a day! (5 min if need be)  Please read below for the benefits of mindfulness meditation!    Some Benefits of Meditation!   Helps reduce stress  Can help manage anxiety  Helps you focus and concentrate  Enhances self-awareness through mindfulness  Can help with memory retention  Increase pain tolerance (resiliency)  Helps with sleep  Helps promote a healthy heart and lowers blood pressure  Can make you happier  Promotes positive attitudes towards yourself and others   Please know there are many different forms of meditation, and whichever you choose to endeavor in has its own range of benefits.  There are two major styles of meditation: (Taken from Health Line Nutrition)   Focused-attention meditation: Concentrates attention on a single object, thought, sound, or visualization. It emphasizes ridding your mind of attention and distraction. Meditation may focus on breathing, a mantra, or a calming sound.  Open-monitoring meditation: Encourages broadened awareness of all aspects of your environment, train of thought, and sense of self. It may include becoming aware of thoughts, feelings, or impulses that you might normally try to suppress.   You‚Äôre not trying to turn off your thoughts or feelings. You‚Äôre learning to observe them without judgment. And eventually, you may start to better understand them as well.
